value.title: Brandi Love Wants Ron DeSantis To Run in 2024 if Donald Trump Doesn't
value.excerpt: "Even I can admit that Donald Trump has an obnoxious arrogance about him that rubs some people the wrong way," the adult film actress told Newsweek.

value.title: New York Times reporter deletes tweet calling Trump supporters ‘enemies of the state’
value.excerpt: A New York Times reporter deleted a tweet that called supporters of former President Trump “enemies of the state,” following a viral blowback online.

value.title: Trump vows ‘we won’t mask our children’ in wake of new CDC recommendation
value.excerpt: Donald Trump blasted the Biden administration after the CDC recommended indoor mask mandates in most areas of the US as well as in all K-12 schools, regardless of vaccination status.

value.title: Texas voters brush aside Trump endorsement and name Jake Ellzey the winner in a House special election in Texas
value.excerpt: The vacancy stemmed from the February death of Rep. Ron Wright, whose widow Susan was endorsed by Trump but who has lagged in fundraising and campaigning.

value.title: Trump, lawmakers honor Sen. Mike Enzi after sudden death from bike accident
value.excerpt: From former President Donald Trump to Rep. Liz Cheney to Sen. Tim Kaine, many on both sides of the aisle remembered the life and accomplishments of Senator Mike Enzi.

value.title: Trump officials can testify to Congress about his role in Capitol attack, DoJ says
value.excerpt: Move declines to assert executive privilege for then acting attorney general Jeffrey Rosen, clearing path for others to testify

value.title: Officer: Trump 'helped create this monstrosity'
value.excerpt: In testimony before the panel probing the attack on the U.S. Capitol, a police sergeant blasted former President Donald Trump's description of the scene as "a loving crowd". (July 27)

value.title: DOJ tells former Trump officials they can testify about efforts to overturn election
value.excerpt: Jeffrey Rosen, who was acting attorney general after William Barr stepped down, is among the officials being allowed to testify.

value.title: PolitiFact declare claims Biden, Harris distrusted COVID vaccine under Trump are 'false' despite past rhetoric
value.excerpt: PolitiFact appears to be shielding President Biden and Vice President Harris from criticism over their past rhetoric expressing distrust in the coronavirus vaccine during the Trump administration.

value.title: Trump ally Thomas Barrack pleads not guilty in foreign lobbying case
value.excerpt: Thomas Barrack, a longtime ally of former President Donald Trump who headed up his presidential inaugural committee, pleaded not guilty on Monday to federal charges stemming from his work unlawfully lobbying the Trump administration on behalf of the United Arab Emirates.

value.title: 'I recommend you take the vaccine' - Donald Trump
value.excerpt: Rough Cuts 'I recommend you take the vaccine' - Donald Trump. Posted . Former U.S. President Donald Trump on Saturday in Arizona called on American's to get the COVID-19 vaccine s

value.title: Donald Trump Jr. Vastly More Popular With Republicans Than Mitch McConnell, Poll Shows
value.excerpt: Donald Trump Jr., who has been a vocal force in the Republican party, was also significantly more popular than House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy.

value.title: Education nonprofit warns Biden nominee Lhamon would 'threaten progress' of Trump-era Title IX protections
value.excerpt: An education nonprofit is warning the Biden administration's commitment to rolling back Title IX's due process protections for individuals accused of sexual harassment on college campuses would erase the progress enacted under the Trump administration.

value.title: Sarah Huckabee Sanders urges people to get the ‘Trump vaccine’
value.excerpt: Former White House press secretary Sarah Huckabee Sanders acknowledged Sunday that she was inoculated against COVID-19 “months ago” — with the “Trump vaccine.”

value.title: Watergate Reporter Carl Bernstein Calls Donald Trump a 'War Criminal'
value.excerpt: Political analyst and Watergate reporter Carl Bernstein called former President Donald Trump a "war criminal" on CNN's Reliable Sources Sunday. He said people need to view Trump in "a different context,

value.title: Sarah Huckabee Sanders Says Biden 'Undercut Public Confidence' in Vaccine by Criticizing Trump Rollout
value.excerpt: "Because of what they heard from politicians and TV 'experts,' many Americans were scared the vaccines were not safe," she said in an op-ed.

value.title: Trump says ‘woke politics’ contributed to US women’s soccer upset at Olympics
value.excerpt: Former President Donald Trump says “woke politics” contributed to the US Women’s soccer team’s dismal opening performance in the Tokyo 2020 Olympics.

value.title: Video Shows Man 'Harassing' Michelle Ugenti-Rita Backstage After Trump Supporters Booed Her
value.excerpt: Rita, a Republican running for Arizona secretary of state, why she "killed Senator Kelly Townsend's election integrity bills in the Senate" in the video.

value.title: Mark Warner: Inflation Today Is Result Of $3.5 Trillion In COVID Spending In 2020 Under Trump
value.excerpt: Democratic Sen. Mark Warner told "FOX News Sunday" that the expanding "human infrastructure" bill will not contribute as much to inflation as did $5 Trillion in COVID spending since last year, "$3.5 trillion of that under President Trump.

value.title: Donald Trump Rips Mike Pence for Not Having 'Courage' on 1/6 to Reject Election Results
value.excerpt: "I only wish that my friend, Mike Pence, had that additional courage to send the results back to the legislatures," Trump said.

value.title: I Alone Can Fix It: Carol Leonnig and Philip Rucker on their Trump bestseller
value.excerpt: The Washington Post reporters have unleashed a second startling story of incompetence and malevolence in the White House

value.title: AP FACT CHECK: Trump is relentless in election fabrications
value.excerpt: Former President Donald Trump is telling some thoroughly debunked stories as he presses his relentless effort to undermine the legitimacy of his election defeat to President Joe Biden

value.title: Biden attacks Trump at Virginia rally, tying McAuliffe’s opponent to ex-president
value.excerpt: After mostly avoiding direct attacks on Trump, Biden says Friday he “whipped Donald Trump in Virginia” and so will McAuliffe, highlighting a key strategy for Democratic candidates: linking opponents to Trump.

value.title: Arizona secretary of state tells Trump before election lie rally: get over it
value.excerpt: Democrat Katie Hobbs says ‘this is nothing more than being a sore loser’ as ex-president heads to Phoenix for event

value.title: Donald Trump was 'almost giddy' watching the Capitol riot on TV, author says
value.excerpt: It took hours for Ivanka Trump and aides to convince the president to rebuke the Capitol riot, according to "I Alone Can Fix It" author Carol Leonnig.

value.title: ‘Such a disgrace’: Trump blasts Cleveland Indians name change
value.excerpt: Former President Donald Trump blasted the Cleveland Indians Friday over their name change announcement. “Can anybody believe that the Cleveland Indians, a storied and cherished baseball franchise since taking the name in 1915,

value.title: Trump advisor says there is 'zero' chance the former president will pick Pence as his running mate if he runs in 2024
value.excerpt: Pence decided to certify the 2020 election results on January 6, instead of unlawfully overturning the results in Trump's favor.

value.title: A scandal-scarred Senate candidate wants Donald Trump’s endorsement. Other Republicans worry he’ll give it.
value.excerpt: Former Missouri governor Eric Greitens, forced from office in 2018, has hired several Trump associates for his campaign and has falsely suggested Trump could replace Biden before the next presidential election.

value.title: Donald Trump Jr. Responds to Kimberly Guilfoyle 'The View' Rumor
value.excerpt: Speculation is growing over the conservative figure who will be chosen to replace Meghan McCain on the ABC show.

value.title: Democrats outraged after the FBI said it got more than 4,500 tips about Brett Kavanaugh — and referred the 'relevant' ones to the Trump White House
value.excerpt: When Kavanaugh was a Supreme Court nominee, the FBI conducted just 10 interviews after receiving thousands of tips, the agency said.
